questions.question:
Veko the Wolf manages a patrol route
where points are added and removed often.

Kaya the Lion first thinks of using an array.

Why does Biru the Monkey suggest
a linked list instead?
options: Linked lists allow easy insertion and deletion

questions.question:
Kaya the Lion learns that
linked lists are made of nodes.

What does each node usually contain?
options: Data and a link to another node

questions.question:
Biru the Monkey explains
singly linked lists.

What information does each node store?
options: Data and both next and previous nodes
Only the head node stores links

questions.question:
Kaya the Lion tries to move backward
in a singly linked list.

Why is this not possible?
options: Nodes do not store previous links

questions.question:
Veko the Wolf now needs to
move forward and backward
along the route.

Which type of linked list
solves this problem?

Biru the Monkey introduces
a circular linked list.

What makes it different?
options: The first node points to null
The last node points back to the head
It stores data in sorted order

questions.question:
Kaya the Lion traverses a linked list.

When should traversal stop
in a singly linked list?
options: When the next pointer is null
When the head is reached again

questions.question:
Kaya the Lion writes logic
to traverse a linked list.

One line is missing.

Which option completes the logic?
questions.code:
```
current = head

WHILE current is not null:
    PROCESS current.data
```
